item.title: Centre revokes GRAP 3 curbs in Delhi-NCR amid dip in pollution levels - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Centre revokes GRAP 3 restrictions in Delhi-NCR amid dip in pollution levels, says order

Date: Jan 17, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Centre's air quality panel has revoked the GRAP 3 restrictions in the Delhi-NCR due to improved air quality. This decision follows the earlier revocation of GRAP 4 restrictions.

  • GRAP 3 restrictions were revoked as pollution levels dipped.
  • Classes up to grade 5 will transition to hybrid mode.
  • Restrictions on BS-III petrol and BS-IV diesel vehicles remain in place.
  • Pollution traditionally peaks during winters due to various local sources.
“As per the air quality and weather forecast provided by IMD/IITM, there is a likelihood of AQI to remain in lower end of the Very Poor category in the coming days owing to the favourable meteorological conditions and strong wind speeds,” said CAQM.

This change in restrictions is hoped to improve daily life while maintaining surveillance on air quality management as necessary.

item.title: Why Govt refused to hold NEET-UG 2025 online despite paper leak controversy - The Indian Express
item.description:
Why Govt refused to hold NEET-UG 2025 online despite paper leak controversy

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

The Union government has decided to conduct the NEET-UG 2025 examination in a pen-and-paper format, despite previous controversies including a paper leak. This decision is rooted in logistical challenges and the significant proportion of rural candidates, who may not be familiar with online testing formats.

  • Despite recommendations to move to computer-based testing, the government reaffirmed the traditional format for NEET-UG.
  • This year, about 28 to 30 lakh candidates are expected to take the exam.
  • Logistical issues, such as accommodating large numbers of candidates and ensuring reliable testing centers, influenced the decision.
  • The large rural student base underlines concerns about equity in the transition to online testing.
“To hold an entrance test in an online format, we can accommodate about 1.5 lakh candidates in one shift,” said a source in the government.

While the government aims to eventually migrate to online testing, no immediate changes are planned for the current exam format. Additional measures to prevent future paper leaks are yet to be disclosed.

item.title: 12 Indians working for Russian Army in Ukraine dead, 16 missing, confirms MEA - The Hindu
item.description:
12 Indians working for Russian Army in Ukraine dead, 16 missing, confirms MEA

Published: January 17, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has confirmed that 12 Indians working with the Russian military have died, while 16 others are reported missing. Russia has communicated these details to India.

  • 12 Indians have been confirmed dead while working for the Russian military.
  • 16 Indians are reported missing, with efforts being made for their release and repatriation.
  • A total of 126 cases of Indian nationals serving in the Russian Army have been noted.
  • 96 Indians have returned to India and are no longer part of the Russian armed forces.
  • The Indian Embassy is involved in the repatriation of remains and treatment of the injured.
“The Russian side has categorised them as missing... We are seeking an early release and repatriation of those who remain.” - Randhir Jaiswal, MEA spokesperson

This situation highlights the ongoing risks faced by Indian nationals involved with foreign militaries amidst the conflict in Ukraine.

item.title: 16 Indians Fighting In Russian Army 'Missing', 12 Killed So Far In Ukraine War: MEA - News18
item.description:
16 Indians Missing, 12 Reported Dead in Ukraine Conflict: MEA Updates

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: News18

At least 16 Indian nationals deployed by the Russian Army in Ukraine are currently missing, with 12 confirmed dead, as reported by the Ministry of External Affairs.

  • There are 126 Indian nationals known to have served in the Russian Army.
  • 96 of these have returned to India, with 18 still in service.
  • 16 are categorized as missing by Russian authorities, while 12 have died in the conflict.
“As of today, there have been 126 cases (of Indian nationals serving in the Russian Army). Of these 126 cases, 96 people have returned to India and have been discharged from the Russian Armed Forces.” - MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal

The Indian embassy is working with Russian authorities to facilitate the repatriation of the deceased's remains and to assist those who are still serving.

item.title: India approves over ₹10,000 crore funds to revive state-owned steel maker RINL - Mint
item.description:
India Approves ₹11,440 Crore for Reviving Steel Maker RINL

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: Live Mint

Introduction

Prime Minister Narendra Modi has approved a significant funding package of ₹11,440 crore to revive Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Limited (RINL), aiming to address its legacy issues and secure raw materials.

Key Points

  • The funding includes ₹10,300 crore in fresh equity and a conversion of a ₹1,140 crore working capital loan.
  • RINL is critical to India's steel sector, located strategically in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh.
  • The revival plan aims to modernize the plant and secure raw materials, benefiting employees and local economies.
  • Modi emphasizes the importance of Aatmanirbhar Bharat in the steel industry.

Notable Quotes

The Visakhapatnam Steel Plant has a special place in the hearts and minds of the people of Andhra Pradesh. During yesterday’s Cabinet meeting, it was decided to provide equity support of over Rs. 10,000 crore for the plant. This has been done understanding the importance of the steel sector in building an Aatmanirbhar Bharat.

Conclusion

This funding package marks a pivotal step towards revitalizing RINL, ensuring its future contribution to India’s steel industry and the region’s economy.

item.title: After JD(U) caution, BJP concern about Delhi poll blowback, Shehzad Poonawalla apologises to Purvanchalis - The Indian Express
item.description:
BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla Apologizes to Purvanchali Community Amid Election Concerns

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: The Indian Express

A day after BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla made derogatory comments against AAP's Rituraj Jha, he issued an apology acknowledging the hurt to the Purvanchali community ahead of Delhi's Assembly elections.

  • The Janata Dal (United) emphasized the need for responsible speech and requested action against Poonawalla.
  • Poonawalla expressed heartfelt apologies on social media, aiming to mend relations with Purvanchalis, a key voting bloc.
  • Concerns arose within BJP about potential backlash from the Purvanchali community in the upcoming elections.
  • BJP's Manoj Tiwari condemned Poonawalla’s remarks, reaffirming the party's expectations for respectful discourse.
  • Arvind Kejriwal criticized the BJP for neglecting Purvanchali needs and misrepresentation.
“I apologise wholeheartedly to my Purvanchali brothers and sisters for the hurt that my comments have caused them.” - Shehzad Poonawalla

This incident raises questions about the BJP's image among Purvanchalis and could impact voter sentiment in the February elections.

item.title: Mahakumbh 2025: Prohibitory orders issued till Feb 28 to safeguard law and order - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mahakumbh 2025: Prohibitory Orders Issued to Ensure Safety

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The additional commissioner of police in Prayagraj has announced the imposition of prohibitory orders from January 16 to February 28 during the Mahakumbh Mela to maintain law and order.

  • The orders come under section 163 of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023.
  • They were passed without notice due to urgency, considering overlapping festivities and potential disruptions.
  • Prohibitory measures aim to prevent activities that can lead to disturbances, maintaining peace for various religious observances and examinations.
  • Specific restrictions include the ban on gatherings and protests without permission, restrictions on carrying weapons, and prevention of provocative speech.
"In view of the communal sensitivity... there is an urgent need to maintain peace." - Additional Commissioner of Police

This initiative underlines the importance of security during the Mahakumbh, ensuring that celebrations occur safely and without incident.

item.title: Arvind Kejriwal calls Ayushman Bharat ‘biggest scam’ after SC stays Delhi HC order - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Arvind Kejriwal calls Ayushman Bharat ‘biggest scam’ after SC stays Delhi HC order

Date: January 17, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Supreme Court has temporarily halted a Delhi High Court order that compelled the Delhi government to sign a memorandum of understanding with the Centre for the implementation of the Ayushman Bharat scheme. AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal criticized the scheme, calling it a 'scam' and expressed relief that the Supreme Court acknowledged its flaws.

  • Supreme Court stayed a High Court order demanding the Delhi government to sign an MoU for Ayushman Bharat.
  • Kejriwal referred to Ayushman Bharat as the 'biggest scam' in the country during a press conference.
  • The Delhi High Court previously directed the government to ensure the scheme's full implementation.
  • Kejriwal's comments arose after a Supreme Court notice to the Centre regarding the Delhi government's plea against the High Court's order.
“Ayushman Bharat is the biggest scam in the country. When the central government changes and an inquiry is conducted into these scams, people will realize how big a scam Ayushman Bharat truly was.” - Arvind Kejriwal

This ruling could have significant implications for the implementation of health infrastructure in Delhi and sheds light on the ongoing political tensions surrounding healthcare policies in the capital.

China has congratulated India's ISRO for successfully docking satellites in space, marking India as the fourth nation to achieve this milestone.

item.description:
8th Pay Commission: Minimum Basic Salary Of Central Govt Employees Likely To Rise Above Rs 40,000

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: News18

The Union Cabinet has approved the 8th Pay Commission, with the minimum basic salary of central government employees expected to exceed ₹40,000 per month from January 1, 2026.

  • The 8th Pay Commission aims to ensure competitive salaries alongside allowances and performance pay.
  • A fitment factor between 2.6 and 2.85 may lead to salary increases of 25-30%.
  • The current minimum salary under the 7th Pay Commission is ₹18,000 per month, which may rise to around ₹36,020 with allowances.
  • The recommendations of the 8th Pay Commission are set to be implemented in early 2026.
  • Periodic pay revisions are crucial to address inflation and maintain equitable remuneration.
“The 8th Pay Commission is pivotal in addressing evolving economic realities…” - Neeti Sharma, CEO of TeamLease Digital

This upcoming pay commission could significantly impact government employees' livelihoods, enhancing financial empowerment and boosting consumption in the economy.

item.description:
Karnataka High Court Stays Trial Against Rahul Gandhi in Defamation Case

Publication Date: January 17 | Source: Live Law

The Karnataka High Court has issued an interim stay on the trial proceedings against Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in a criminal defamation case filed by the State BJP. The court will hear the case further on February 20.

  • The Karnataka High Court stayed the trial court proceedings against Rahul Gandhi.
  • The case pertains to defamation claims by the BJP over Congress's “Corruption Rate card” advertisements.
  • The BJP accused Gandhi of maligning their reputation before elections.
  • The court has issued an emergent notice to the respondent, returnable by February 20.
  • Gandhi was previously granted bail in a related case in June last year.
“Emergent notice to the respondent returnable by February 20. By way of interim order, there shall be a stay of further proceedings.”

This stay allows Rahul Gandhi temporary relief in a politically charged defamation case ahead of upcoming elections.

The BJP aims to make Delhi corruption-free and considers this manifesto as the foundation for a developed Delhi.

US Consulate Opens in Bengaluru, Heralding New Chapter in US-India Relations

Date: January 17, 2025, Source: Indian Express

After nearly two decades, the US Consulate in Bengaluru was inaugurated, significantly enhancing US-India relations, particularly in technology and innovation.

  • The consulate will initially not process visa applications but aims to do so soon.
  • Minister Jaishankar emphasized the consulate's importance for business and tourism.

The opening of the US Consulate in Bengaluru symbolizes strengthened bilateral ties and will provide benefits to American companies and Indian citizens seeking to travel to the US.

item.title: Kolkata Court To Deliver Verdict On RG Kar Rape-Murder Case On January 18 - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Kolkata Court to Announce Verdict in RG Kar Rape-Murder Case on January 18

Publication Date: January 17, 2024

Source: LiveLaw

A sessions court in Kolkata's Sealdah area is set to deliver its verdict on the RG Kar rape and murder case involving a trainee doctor who was tragically assaulted and killed after her night shift. The incident triggered nationwide protests and legal actions, leading to a transfer of the case to the CBI and involvement of the Supreme Court.

  • The incident occurred in August 2024, sparking public outrage and protests throughout India.
  • The case was transferred to the CBI after investigations by the West Bengal CID faced criticism.
  • The Supreme Court intervened to frame workplace safety guidelines for doctors and monitor the investigation.
  • Protests demanded justice and accountability for the individuals involved in the cover-up.
  • Only one accused, Sanjoy Roy, has a chargesheet filed against him; others were granted bail due to delays in the investigation.
  • The verdict on January 18 will determine the legal standing of the charges against Roy.
“The victim's family and supporters are eagerly awaiting justice.”

This case has highlighted significant issues regarding safety in workplaces for healthcare professionals, and the verdict is highly anticipated within the community.

item.title: What to expect from the new US consulate in Bengaluru - The Indian Express
item.description:
What to expect from the new US consulate in Bengaluru

Publication Date: January 17, 2024

Source: Indian Express

The new US consulate in Bengaluru aims to enhance economic and political relations between the US and Karnataka, becoming the fifth US consulate in India.

  • The consulate will strengthen trade relations and support investment ecosystems.
  • It is not expected to process visa applications immediately upon opening.
  • The formal announcement for the consulate's establishment was made during PM Narendra Modi's visit to the US in June 2023.
  • Bengaluru is significant due to its role as India's IT hub, with a large number of US-based multinational companies.
  • The consulate will initially focus on economic and political ties before starting visa services.
“The consulate in Bengaluru will hopefully open in January 2025.” - Eric Garcetti, outgoing US Ambassador to India

The establishment of this consulate is anticipated to significantly benefit US businesses and ease the visa process for residents in southern Karnataka.

item.title: Fact Check: 'IITian Baba' Or Ex-Brahmos Engineer Convicted For Espionage? Details Inside - NDTV
item.description:
Fact Check: 'IITian Baba' Or Ex-Brahmos Engineer Convicted For Espionage? Details Inside

Publication Date: January 17, 2025 Source: PTI, republished by NDTV

The article investigates claims circulating on social media that a man identified as Nishant Agarwal, a former BrahMos Aerospace engineer, was sentenced to life imprisonment for spying for Pakistan. The investigation finds that the man in the photo is actually Abhey Singh, known as 'IITian Baba', who is not connected to the espionage case.

  • The claim surfaced after an interview with Abhey Singh at the Maha Kumbh.
  • Singh is a self-styled holy man and a graduate of IIT Bombay.
  • Nishant Agarwal was sentenced to life imprisonment in June 2024 for espionage.
  • The PTI Fact Check Desk confirmed the misidentification through various sources and image analysis.
“The photo was shared on social media with false claims,” - PTI Fact Check.

The investigation clarified that Abhey Singh is not involved in espionage and was wrongly identified as Nishant Agarwal.

‘Ready to wait for five years, snatch justice if needed’: Father of RG Kar victim ahead of court verdict

The verdict in the R G Kar rape and murder case is anticipated soon, with the victim's father expressing readiness to wait for justice and vowing not to beg but to fight for it. He is focused on the accountability of the prime accused and has concerns regarding the investigation's thoroughness.

item.title: Naidu to wind up village secretariats?.. - Greatandhra
item.description:
Naidu Considers Disbanding Village Secretariats in Andhra Pradesh

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Great Andhra

The Telugu Desam Party led by Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu is contemplating the dismantling of the village and ward secretariat system instituted by the previous government. A decision is anticipated soon, as discussions have taken place in the state cabinet.

  • The previous YSRCP government established these secretariats to enhance welfare scheme delivery, employing approximately 1.5 lakh secretaries.
  • The current government feels the system has not achieved its goals and plans to rationalize the workforce.
  • There are around 15,000 secretariats, each staffed by roughly 12 secretaries.
  • Naidu’s plan involves reorganizing employees into multipurpose roles, with new positions, like “aspirational secretary.”
  • The Village/Ward Secretariat Employees’ Federation has called for consultations before any major changes are made.
  • Speculation exists that if rationalization fails, the entire system may be abolished and integrated into standard government operations.
No formal decision has been reached yet, but discussions are expected during the next cabinet meeting.

The potential disbandment of the system raises concerns and hints at significant workforce restructuring within the state's administrative framework.

item.title: Supreme Court Stays HC Order Requiring Delhi Govt To Sign MoU With Centre On Implementation Of PM-ABHIM... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Halts Delhi HC Order on PM-ABHIM MoU

Publication Date: Today

Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court today stayed the Delhi High Court order requiring the Delhi government to sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Centre for the implementation of the PM-Ayushman Bharat Health Infrastructure Mission (PM-ABHIM) in Delhi.

  • The Supreme Court's bench comprised Justices BR Gavai and AG Masih.
  • The Delhi government challenged the High Court's order, citing concerns over the scope of the Centre's powers in health matters.
  • Delhi government's counsel argued that while the Centre could cover 60% of capital expenditure, it would not fund running costs.
  • The High Court's order arose from a public interest litigation (PIL) about ICU beds and ventilator availability.
  • Previously, the High Court expressed concerns about insufficient medical infrastructure in Delhi.
“Non-implementation of the PM-ABHIM Scheme in Delhi, when 33 States/UTs have already implemented the same, would not be justified.”

In conclusion, the Supreme Court's stay on the High Court's directive highlights ongoing tensions between local and federal health authorities regarding the implementation of critical health infrastructure projects.

item.title: Sharon Raj murder: Kerala court convicts girlfriend Greeshma and her uncle - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Kerala Court Convicts Greeshma and Uncle in Sharon Raj Murder Case

Published on: 17 Jan 2025, 6:59 am

A Kerala court has convicted Greeshma, the primary suspect in the murder of 23-year-old Sharon Raj, with sentencing scheduled for January 18.

  • Greeshma was found guilty of kidnapping, murder, and destruction of evidence.
  • Her uncle was also convicted, while her mother was acquitted.
  • The murder transpired amidst a turbulent relationship that Greeshma wanted to end.
  • Sharon allegedly ingested a poisoned Ayurvedic tonic given by Greeshma during a visit.
  • The case ignited public outrage and was investigated by a special Crime Branch team.
“The case sparked widespread outrage, leading to an in-depth investigation.”

The conviction highlights the serious legal repercussions of such violent actions and the complex dynamics of personal relationships.
